Key Match Events: Bradley Barcola scored in the first minute of the match
Italy came back from a goal down to win 3-1 against France
Federico Dimarco volleyed home a deft backheel pass from Sandro Tonali to level the score
Davide Frattesi put Italy ahead five minutes after the interval
Giacomo Raspadori gave the visitors the breathing space they needed in the 74th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Sandro Tonali made his first Italy appearance since his ban
The match was played at the Parc des Princes
Post-Match Reflections: Italy manager Luciano Spalletti praised Sandro Tonali's performance, saying he gave two good bursts in the match
Spalletti also described the match as'magnificent'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played behind closed doors in Hungary due to security concerns
The Parc des Princes crowd was silenced by Italy's 3-1 win over France
Italy's win puts them top of the table alongside Belgium
Others: The Nations League Group A2 match between Italy and France was a highly entertaining game
Italy's comeback win was a significant result in the competition
